title: Foreign Catch Data (NAFO)
text: Data stored NAFO’s site stored STATLANT 21 database served user one two formats. Visit comparison data

title: Foreign Catch Data (NAFO)
text: Less detailed complete. years near 100% submission Contains information ANNUAL catches (metric tons) species, subareas/division, country, year. Data extraction tool provided select subsets data. tool allows output (export) data Microsoft Excel, PDF, comma-separated values formats. Catches broken month effort data fishing gear data. Example data:

title: Foreign Catch Data (NAFO)
text: countries submit. Especially USA. countries provide catch effort. Contains MONTHLY catch effort information year, country, fishing gear, vessel tonnage, main species, division, year. database large, Secretariat makes available web number comma-delimited text files containing ONE decade . mainSpecies field reported target species, however actual species caught specified speciesEffort Code field. column names changed decades: Code renamed SpeciesEffort 2000 onward GearCode renamed Gear 2000 onward DivCode renamed AreaCode 2000 onward Catches renamed Month_NK 2000 onward Country, Gear, Tonnage, MainSpecies, AreaCode fields contain coded values. description codes can found supporting files (exported data) Gear -> gear.txt AreaCode -> divisions.txt Tonnage -> tonnage.txt Country -> country.txt MainSpecies -> main species.txt SpeciesEffort -> species.txt Caution: format content supporting files changes decade decade. files tab delimited others comma delimited. files name switch tab comma delimited decades

title: Foreign Catch Data (NAFO)
text: Effort field ignored. Values “0 means effort data available 1 9 mean data (explanation difference) practice values seem used differently different time periods”. somewhat redundant since effort data recorded month. field SpeciesEffort help determine effort levels. example, SpeciesEffort = 1 - Hours Fished, total number hours spent fishing NAFO regulatory area = 2 - Days Fished, number days fishing took place. = 3 - Days ground, number days vessel NAFO regulatory area whether fishing = Anything else (Species codes listed species.txt). data shown 3 ton vessel Canada Maritimes & Quebec (Country = 2), using Bottom otter trawl (GearCode = 10), targeted American plaice (mainSpecies = 10), division 32, fished 74 hours June period 10 days (~7.4 hours per day) caught 38 tons Atlantic cod (Code = 101) 114 tons American plaice (Code = 112) vessel reported 67 hours fishing 8 days ~ 8.375 hours per day.

what: Use of NAFO data in comlandr
title: Foreign Catch Data (NAFO)
text: data database 21B used comlandr. Years missing data supplemented 21A Effort considered. species, catch aggregated countries (USA omitted) year. DivCode/AreaCode mapped Northeast United States (NEUS) Ecological Production Units (EPU’s). Gear codes mapped Northeast Fisheries Science Center (NEFSC) gear codes. resulting data merged NEFSC landings data.

title: Compare NAFO 21A & 21B databases
text: Data stored NAFO’s site stored STATLANT 21 database served user one two formats. differences explained package.

title: Compare NAFO 21A & 21B databases
text: NAFO spatial domain “covers large portion Atlantic Ocean, including 200-mile zones Coastal States — Canada, Greenland, St. Pierre et Miquelon USA.”. R package comlandr focuses Northeast United States (NEUS) shown fisheries statistcal areas defined Greater Atlantic Regional Fisheries Office (GARFO). NAFO divisions map NEUS domain shown second panel.  remainder document following figures based smaller area.

title: Compare NAFO 21A & 21B databases
text: Catch USA reported stored NEFSC databases. Prior NAFO database comparisons catch USA removed. Catch divisions 4X, 5Y, 5Z, 6A, 6B, 6C (NEUS equivalent) area used. Aggregated Country Species 21A 21B

title: Overview
text: Although US landings data (SPPLIVLB) pulled STOCKEFF can retrieved early 1964, species value (SPPVALUE) available 1982. Prior date value can reliably validated. Menhaden landings complete commercial database.

title: comlandr
text: need ROracle installed configured machine

title: comlandr
text: can make connection follows: channel <- dbutils::connect_to_database(server="servername",uid="yourUsername") channel object inherited ROracle package. object passed argument functions comlandr

title: comlandr
text: Pulling raw data takes 15 minutes complete. see get_comland_raw_data details. pull raw (unprocessed) commercial data : Years 1964 2023 shellfish represented landed weight (opposed live weight) Statistical Area resulting data object list containing several fields. See get_comland_raw_data details. data considered raw data contain corrections stock assessment scientists may . example, market categories representing parts fish removed. Note: Herring Menhaden data underrepresented raw data pull. Herring data pulled separately another database. Menhaden excluded due confidentiality concerns
code: data <- get_comland_raw_data(channel,filterByYear = 1964:2023)

title: comlandr
text: pull processed raw data, use get_comland_data pull raw data () process depending input arguments supplied. options processing : Include Herring data Remove fish parts Include foreign landings NAFO Adjust species value based reference year Separate skate hake landings species based survey proportions Aggregate landings user defined groupings Statistical areas Aggregate gear codes based user supplied fleets Attempt assign values missing data See articles section depth explanation components comlandr
code: data <- get_comland_data(channel,filterByYear = 1964:2023)

what: Pulls and processes commercial fishing data from the Northeast US
title: Pulls and processes commercial fishing data from the Northeast US
text: comlandr allows users pull process commercial fishing data Northeast USA. Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organization (NAFO) data included capture landings non US fleets US waters. use package need: behind NEFSC firewall Permissions access required server/database : username password. Oracle’s instant Client installed Oracle’s R package ROracle installed

title: Pulls and processes commercial fishing data from the Northeast US
text: remotes::install_github("NOAA-EDAB/comlandr")

title: Pulls and processes commercial fishing data from the Northeast US
text: repository scientific product official communication National Oceanic Atmospheric Administration, United States Department Commerce. NOAA GitHub project code provided ‘’ basis user assumes responsibility use. claims Department Commerce Department Commerce bureaus stemming use GitHub project governed applicable Federal law. reference specific commercial products, processes, services service mark, trademark, manufacturer, otherwise, constitute imply endorsement, recommendation favoring Department Commerce. Department Commerce seal logo, seal logo DOC bureau, shall used manner imply endorsement commercial product activity DOC United States Government.

Pulls processes NAFO (Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organization) data Uses survey data apportion hake complex species Uses survey data apportion skate complex species Ajusts species value specified date

what: Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
title: Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
text: Extract list statistical areas, region, NAFO codes, etc NEFSC "Area" supporting table

title: Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
code: get_areas(channel, areas = "all")

title: Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
text: channel Object inherited Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see connect_to_database) areas specific area code set codes. Either numeric character vector. Defaults "" areas Numeric codes converted VARCHAR2(3 BYTE) creating sql statement. Character codes short character strings reference AREANM field.

title: Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
text: list returned:  data containing result executed sqlStatement sql containing sql call colNames vector table's column names default sql statement "select * cfdbs.area" used

title: Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
text: Use data dictionary field name explanations

title: Extract AREA information from CFDBS — get_areas
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # extracts complete area table based on default sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_areas(channel)  # extracts a subset of area data based on selected areas 100,500 (numeric) channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_areas(channel,areas=c(100,500))  # extracts a subset of area data based on selected areas 100,500 (character) channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_areas(channel,areas=c("100","500"))  # extracts a subset of area data based on areanm's containing "GG" (Androscoggin River etc) channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_areas(channel,"GG")  } # }

what: Extracts commercial discard data from Database — get_comdisc_data
title: Extracts commercial discard data from Database — get_comdisc_data
text: Connects obdbs pulls discard data, calculates discard kept ratios, applies landings data obtained using get_comland_data.

title: Extracts commercial discard data from Database — get_comdisc_data
code: get_comdisc_data(   channel,   comland,   aggArea = F,   areaDescription = "EPU",   propDescription = "MeanProp",   aggGear = F,   fleetDescription = "Fleet",   extendTS = T )

title: Extracts commercial discard data from Database — get_comdisc_data
text: channel Object inherited Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see connect_to_database) comland Data frame. Result get_comland_data aggArea boolean. Aggregate Statistical Areas larger spatial units (Default = F) areaDescription character string. Field name userAreas denoting spatial unit. (Default = "EPU") propDescription character string. Field name userAreas denoting scaling factor. (Default = "MeanProp") aggGear boolean. Aggregate NEGEAR codes larger "fleets" (Default = F) fleetDescription character string. Field name userGears denoting Fleet. (Default = "Fleet") extendTS Boolean. DK (Discard kept) ratio extended applied landings beyond observer coverage time period (Discards started 1989). Default = T

title: Extracts commercial discard data from Database — get_comdisc_data
text: Data frame (data.table) (n x 10) row data.table represents species record given tow/trip YEAR Year trip/tow MONTH Month trip/tow NEGEAR Fishing gear used trip/tow TONCL1 Tonnage class fishing vessel NESPP3 Species code (3 charachters) NESPP4 Species code market code (4 characters) AREA Statistical area species reportly caught UTILCD Utilization code SPPLIVLB live weight (landed = "n") landed weight (landed="y") lbs SPPVALUE value landed catch nearest dollar (U.S.), paid fisherman dealer, given species.

what: Extracts observer data from Database — get_comdisc_raw_data
title: Extracts observer data from Database — get_comdisc_raw_data
text: Connects obdbs pulls fields OBSPP, OBINC, ASMSPP, ASMINC

title: Extracts observer data from Database — get_comdisc_raw_data
code: get_comdisc_raw_data(channel, filterByYear)

title: Extracts observer data from Database — get_comdisc_raw_data
text: channel Object inherited Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see connect_to_database) filterByYear numeric vector. Years retrieve data (Default = NA, pull years)

title: Extracts observer data from Database — get_comdisc_raw_data
text: Data frame (data.table) (n x 10) row data.table represents species record given tow/trip YEAR Year trip/tow MONTH Month trip/tow NEGEAR Fishing gear used trip/tow TONCL1 Tonnage class fishing vessel NESPP3 Species code (3 charachters) NESPP4 Species code market code (4 characters) AREA Statistical area species reportly caught UTILCD Utilization code SPPLIVLB live weight (landed = "n") landed weight (landed="y") lbs SPPVALUE value landed catch nearest dollar (U.S.), paid fisherman dealer, given species.

what: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
title: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
text: Connects Population dynamics Database STOCKEFF pull US landings data. Data also pulled NAFO (foreign landings) State Maine (Herring). sources data aggregated, species value adjusted user defined reference year, skate hake landings (often reported unclassified category) split based bottom trawl survey, missing values imputed. information regarding methods see vignette("Overview", package = "comlandr")

title: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
code: get_comland_data(   channel,   filterByYear = NA,   filterByArea = NA,   useLanded = T,   removeParts = T,   useHerringMaine = T,   useForeign = T,   refYear = NA,   refMonth = NA,   disagSkatesHakes = T,   aggArea = F,   userAreas = comlandr::mskeyAreas,   areaDescription = "EPU",   propDescription = "MeanProp",   applyProp = F,   aggGear = F,   userGears = comlandr::mskeyGears,   fleetDescription = "Fleet",   unkVar = c("MONTH", "NEGEAR", "AREA"),   knStrata = c("HY", "QY", "MONTH", "NEGEAR", "TONCL2", "AREA") )

title: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
text: channel Object inherited Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see connect_to_database) filterByYear numeric vector. Years retrieve data (Default = NA, pull years) filterByArea numeric vector. Statistical Areas retrieve data (Default = NA, pull areas) useLanded boolean. Default = T removeParts boolean. Remove species parts (Heads, wings, etc), Default = T useHerringMaine boolean. Pull data Maine Herring database use herring data commercial landings database (Default = T) useForeign boolean. Pull foreign data NAFO. Default = T refYear numeric. Reference year use adjusting species value refMonth numeric. Reference month use adjusting species value disagSkatesHakes boolean. Partition skates hake unclassified landings species (Default = T) aggArea boolean. Aggregate Statistical Areas larger spatial units (Default = F) userAreas data frame. Spatial units Statistical areas aggregated (eg. mskeyAreas) areaDescription character string. Field name userAreas denoting spatial unit. (Default = "EPU") propDescription character string. Field name userAreas denoting scaling factor. (Default = "MeanProp") applyProp boolean. Apply proportions userAreas landings value (Default = T) aggGear boolean. Aggregate NEGEAR codes larger "fleets" (Default = F) userGears data frame. Fleet designations NEGEAR codes grouped (eg.  mskeyGears) fleetDescription character string. Field name userGears denoting Fleet. (Default = "Fleet") unkVar character vector. Variables data, missing values, wish assign value . (unkVar = NULL skips assigning unknowns) knStrata character vector. Variables data wish use use assign values unkVar

title: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
text: Data frame (data.table) (n x 12) row data.table represents species record given tow/trip YEAR Year trip/tow MONTH Month trip/tow NEGEAR/Fleet Fishing gear used trip/tow aggregated Fleet TONCL2 Tonnage class fishing vessel (2 digit value) NESPP3 Species code (3 charachters) MARKET_CODE market code (2 characters) MESHCAT Code describe mesh size trawl vessel AREA/EPU Statistical area/ Ecological Production Unit species reportly caught UTILCD Utilization code US Landing USA vessels foreign vessels SPPLIVMT Weight metric tons. SPPVALUE value landed catch nearest dollar (U.S.), paid fisherman dealer, given species.

title: Extracts and processes commercial data from Database — get_comland_data
text: arguments rely choice others. aggArea = T user must also supply userAreas data frame areaDescription string denote field userArea maps statistical area larger spatial unit. aggGear = T user must also supply userGears data frame fleetDescription string denote field userGears maps NEGEAR codes fleet designation. either aggArea = T aggGear = T user wants assign values missing variables (.e. unkVar != NULL) unkVar knStrata need include values areaDescription fleetDescription respectively

what: Extracts commercial data from Database — get_comland_raw_data
title: Extracts commercial data from Database — get_comland_raw_data
text: Connects Population dynamics Database STOCKEFF. database contains information WOLANDS, WODETS, CFDETS CAMS.

title: Extracts commercial data from Database — get_comland_raw_data
code: get_comland_raw_data(   channel,   filterByYear = NA,   filterByArea = NA,   useLanded = T,   removeParts = T )

title: Extracts commercial data from Database — get_comland_raw_data
text: channel Object inherited Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see connect_to_database) filterByYear numeric vector. Years retrieve data (Default = NA, pull years) filterByArea numeric vector. Statistical Areas retrieve data (Default = NA, pull areas) useLanded boolean. Default = T removeParts boolean. Remove species parts (Heads, wings, etc), Default = T

title: Extracts commercial data from Database — get_comland_raw_data
text: Data frame (data.table) (n x 10) row data.table represents species record given tow/trip YEAR Year trip/tow MONTH Month trip/tow NEGEAR Fishing gear used trip/tow TONCL2 Two digit Tonnage class code fishing vessel NESPP3 Species code (3 charachters) NESPP4 Species code market code (4 characters) AREA Statistical area species reportly caught UTILCD Utilization code SPPLIVMT live weight (landed = "n") landed weight (landed="y") lbs SPPVALUE value landed catch nearest dollar (U.S.), paid fisherman dealer, given species.

title: Downloads all NAFO data — get_foreign_data
text: Downloads, imports, aggregates NAFO data 21B data base

title: Downloads all NAFO data — get_foreign_data
code: get_foreign_data(   filterByYear = NA,   filterByArea = NA,   removeUSA = T,   aggregateCountry = T )

title: Downloads all NAFO data — get_foreign_data
text: filterByYear Numeric vector. Years data required filterByArea Character vector. NAFO Areas data required removeUSA Boolean. USA landings removed data set (Default = T, remove) aggregateCountry Boolean. catch aggregated country codes? (Default = T)

title: Downloads all NAFO data — get_foreign_data
text: Data frame: NAFO data Year Year catch MONTH Month catch QY Quatere year catch. Jan-Mar = 1, ..., Oct-Dec = 4 GearCode NAFO gear code Tonnage Size class vessel DivCode Division code vessel reported catch NAFOCode NAFO species code landed fish SPPLIVMT catch Metric tons Country Reporting country - aggregateCounty = F NESPP3 NEFSC species code

text: channel Object inherited Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see connect_to_database) gears specific gear code set codes. Either numeric character vector. Defaults "" gears. Numeric codes converted VARCHAR2(2 BYTE) creating sql statement. Character codes short character strings referencing GEARNM field.

title: Extract fishing GEAR types from CFDBS — get_gears
text: list returned:  data containing result executed sqlStatement sql containing sql call colNames vector table's column names sqlStatement provided default sql statement "select * cfdbs.gear" used

text: Use data dictionary field name explanations

title: Extract fishing GEAR types from CFDBS — get_gears
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # extracts gear data from cfdbs.gear table based on the default \code{sqlStatement} channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_gears(channel)  # extracts info based on gear types (5,6) (numeric) channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_gears(channel,gears=c(5,6))  # extracts info based on gear types (5,6) (character) channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_gears(channel,gears=c("05","06"))  # extracts info for "Seines" channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_gears(channel,"seines")  } # }

Statistical Areas retrieve data (Default = NA, pull areas) useForeign boolean. Pull foreign data NAFO. Default = T

title: Extract LOCATION information from CFDBS — get_locations
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # extracts complete locations table based on default sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_locations(channel)  # extracts subset of location information. Statistical area, and 10 minute square based # on custom sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") sqlStatement <- "select area TENMSQ from cfdbs.loc;" get_locations(channel,sqlStatement)  # extracts 10 minute square info for an area on geaorges bank (511) based on custom sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") sqlStatement <- "select area, tenmsq  from cfdbs.loc where area=511;" get_locations(channel,sqlStatement) } # }

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS — get_species
text: channel Object inherited Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see connect_to_database) species specific species code set codes. Either numeric character vector. (NESPP3 codes) Numeric codes converted VARCHAR2(3 BYTE) creating sql statement. Species common name can also supplied. character string used pull SPPNM field. Defaults "" species.

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS — get_species
text: list returned:  data containing result executed $sql statement sql containing sql call colNames vector table's column names default sql statement "select * cfdbs.cfspp" used

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS — get_species
text: Use data dictionary field name explanations. Note: species codes (nespp3) stored database VARCHAR2(3 BYTE)

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS — get_species
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # extracts complete species table based on custom sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_species(channel)  # extracts info for cod (081) channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_species(channel,species=81)  # extracts info for cod ("COD") channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_species(channel,"cod") get_species(channel,"co") get_species(channel,"COD")   # extracts info for cod (081)  and bluefish (023) channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") sqlStatement <- "select * from cfdbs.cfspp" get_species(channel,species= c("081","023")) } # }

code: get_species_itis(channel, species = "all", nameType = "common_name")

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS (SPECIES_ITIS_NE, table) — get_species_itis
text: channel Object inherited Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see connect_to_database) species specific species code set codes. Either numeric character vector. Defaults "" species. Numeric codes (SPECIES_ITIS, NESPP4) converted VARCHAR2 (6 4 characters respectively) creating sql statement. nameType Character string. Upper lower case. Either "common_name" (default), "scientific_name" "nespp4". Determines type name search .

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS (SPECIES_ITIS_NE, table) — get_species_itis
text: list returned:  data containing result executed $sql statement sql containing sql call colNames vector table's column names default sql statement "select * cfdbs.SPECIES_ITIS_NE" used

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS (SPECIES_ITIS_NE, table) — get_species_itis
text: Use data dictionary field name explanations.

title: Extract SPECIES information from CFDBS (SPECIES_ITIS_NE, table) — get_species_itis
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # extracts complete species table based on custom sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_species_itis(channel)  # extracts info for cod (164712) channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_species_itis(channel,species=164712)  # extracts info for cod ("COD") channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_species_itis(channel,"cod") #o r get_species_itis(channel,"co") # or (note also return cockles, calico scallop etc.) get_species_itis(channel,"COD")  # extracts info for cod ("gadus") channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_species_itis(channel,"gadus",nameType="scientific_name") #o r get_species_itis(channel,"morh",nameType="scientific_name") #o r get_species_itis(channel,"GADUS",nameType="scientific_name") #o r  #' # extracts info for cod ("0814") market category 4 channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_species_itis(channel,"0814",nameType="NESPP4") #o r get_species_itis(channel,814,nameType="NESPP4")   # extracts info for cod (164712)  and bluefish (168559) channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") sqlStatement <- "select * from cfdbs.species_itis_ne" get_species_itis(channel,species= c("164712","168559")) } # }

what: Extract VESSEL information from CFDBS — get_vessels
title: Extract VESSEL information from CFDBS — get_vessels
text: Extract list vessell ID's, tonnage, crew size, home port, etc NEFSC "Mstrvess" supporting table

title: Extract VESSEL information from CFDBS — get_vessels
code: get_vessels(   channel,   sqlStatement = "select * from cfdbs.mstrvess",   where = NULL )

title: Extract VESSEL information from CFDBS — get_vessels
text: channel Object inherited Oracle. object used connect communicate database engine. (see connect_to_database) sqlStatement sql statement (optional) text string appending clause sql

title: Extract VESSEL information from CFDBS — get_vessels
text: list returned:  data containing result executed sqlStatement sql containing sqlStatement colNames vector table's column names sqlStatement provided default sql statement "select * cfdbs.mstrvess" used

title: Extract VESSEL information from CFDBS — get_vessels
text: Use data dictionary field name explanations

title: Extract VESSEL information from CFDBS — get_vessels
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # extracts complete vessel table based on custom sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") get_vessels(channel)  # extracts vessel ID, crew size, and home port on custom sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") sqlStatement <- "select vessel, crew, homeport from cfdbs.mstrvess;" get_vessels(channel,sqlStatement)  # extracts all vessel info for vessels lengths < 50ft based on custom sql statement channel <- connect_to_database(server="name_of_server",uid="individuals_username") sqlStatement <- "select * from cfdbs.mstrvess where vesslen <29;" get_vessels(channel,sqlStatement) } # }

title: Plots comlands data — plot_comland
text: Comland data landings value landings plotted EPU time either GEAR type, Quarter Year (QY), vessel SIZE, location landings (US/nonUS)

title: Plots comlands data — plot_comland
code: plot_comland(data, by, type = "landings", range = NA, free.y = T)

title: Plots comlands data — plot_comland
text: data Data frame. Output comland.r Character string. variable within data want plot (GEAR, QY, SIZE, US) type Character string. Plot either 'landings' (default) 'value'. range Numeric vector. Range years plot.  Default value plots years. free.y Boolean. Allow y-axis rescale per "" group (Default = T)

title: comlandr 0.3.0
text: Standalone functionality pulling NAFO data get_foreign_data - pulls data NAFOs STATLANT 21B database

title: comlandr 0.2.0
text: Added supporting get functions pull information supporting oracle tables get_areas - pull stat area, region, NAFO codes get_gears - pull gear type, codes, description get_vessels - pull tonnage, crew size get_locations - pull lat, lon, 10 min sq. get_ports - pull port names locations get_species - pull species name, market code information get_species_itis - pull species itis information

title: comlandr 0.1.0
text: Initial release
